flawed_nl_solution:
If 5000 square feet represents one-quarter of the second floor storage space, then the second floor has 5000*4=<<5000*4=20000>>20000 square feet of storage space.
Since the first floor has twice as much space as the second floor, then the first floor has 20000*2=<<20000*2=40000>>40000 square feet of storage space.
Altogether, when empty, the entire building has 20000+40000=<<20000+40000=60000>>60000 square feet of storage space.
Since the second floor has 5000 square feet of storage space filled with boxes, then there are 60000-5000=550000 square feet of unused storage space still available in the building.
#### 550000

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 55000, not 550000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
